p: Each heatwave increases the TRD risk by 2.47 times for people under age 75 years. In Spain, in 2020, the number of days per year in which heatwave thresholds are exceeded is twice as high as during the mid-1980s [ 81]. AEMET (Spanish State Meteorological Agency; http://www.aemet.es accessed on 9 January 2021) climate projections for the 21st century show an increase of about 20% in the number of warm days by the middle of the century; the frequency of extremely hot nights has increased tenfold from 1984 in the more populated Spanish cities [ 81]. Thus, for example, the threshold to consider a heatwave in Malaga city (Southern Spain) is 36.6 Â°C [ 82], which has been exceeded on 11 days during the summer of 2019 and seven during the summer of 2020. This implies an increase in TRD risk for people under age 75 years calculated at 17.3% only during that one summer. The trend identified from REDIAM data is a doubling of heatwave days from 1992 to 2020 (from 4 to 8 days) ( Figure 1B).
